page.title: 01RECREATION--LEEK GROWING--
page.content: Leeks are usually sown under glass in March, set out in the nursery in April, and planted in prepared trenches, in June or July.For success rich soil is needed and it is common on poor soil to open wide, deep trenches and to fill in a five inch layer of animal manure at the bottom. As growth develops, the earth from the sides of the trenches is drawn up against the plants with the result that the lower portion of the leaves become blanched. Good leeks for ordinary purposes can be grown if a wide hole is made for each by working a dibber round in the soil refilling the hole with rich soil so the surface is just a little lower than the ground.Leeks are usually ready in late Autumn.
